intro: Gyrostemon brachystigma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved gyrostemon, is a small, shrub-like plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid regions, adapting to harsh environmental conditions. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, blooming in spring, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Gyrostemon brachystigma is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited to low-nutrient environments.
